intro: Leucas martinicensis, commonly known as the West Indian verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in clusters during the warm season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive appearance and resilience.
